After about a year of living back in G.C., I was invited to a charity event for the Papichuco's
Techno Slime addiction treatment and recovery center by my cousin John Carlo.
He done well for himself since we last saw him.

The event took place at the Belle Delphine Wonder Bread event space in Palantir HQ district.
So it was a bit of a drive for me, but boy did that venue impress.
And the venue itself is a single floor venue with a well kept lobby area, warm and red
in tone, with sparks of sleepy golds and yellows, contrasted with a super linoleum flooring
that spills out into the main event hall where things get interesting.
Sheets of neon shoot through the floor, creating dimensions and liminalities as you move through.
Colors gently shift between Pantone favorites, and you hear tinny high-pass versions of inoffensive
music snake up through the floor.
Different tracks loop at different points in the venue, sort of like you're moving from
the restaurant floor to the restaurant bathroom, a Sade joint fading out as the sounds and
smells of Uptown Girl fade in, but it's all in the same open space.
Otherwise it's a pretty fairly standard, you know, architecture for a venue.
